intro: Mediocalcar umboiense, commonly known as the Umbonese rock orchid, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Umboi in the Southern Hemisphere. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and unique, spurred orchid flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. Its botanical features include fleshy roots and a short, upright stem with a single, showy flower at the apex. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Mediocalcar umboiense is considered an endangered species.
